content:
As an AI language model I do not have personal opinions or beliefs, but from historical records, it is difficult to know for certain whether Elizabeth regretted not getting married and having children. Elizabeth was known for being a shrewd and pragmatic monarch who placed the interests of the state above her personal concerns. Elizabeth believed that marriage could weaken her authority as a queen and potentially lead to foreign interference in English affairs. She famously declared that she was "married to the people" and that her duties as a queen were her only "husband and family". 

While Elizabeth was not known to be particularly sentimental or romantic, there were moments during her reign when she expressed regret at not having a spouse or children. In her later years, she commented to one of her courtiers that she wished she had been able to have at least one child to carry on her legacy. Nevertheless, Elizabeth remained devoted to her duties as a queen and maintained a strong and stable reign for over four decades.
